intro: Cardamine rostrata var. alpina, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and is often found in high-altitude ecosystems. Its botanical features make it an important indicator species for alpine biodiversity.
